availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Lincoln County, Kentucky, native. Son of David and Katherine Gaines Rousseau. Brother of Lovell H. Rousseau. Married to Mary Dozier Rousseau in November 1839. Father of Kate Rousseau and Emma I. Rousseau. Married to Jane Nolan Rousseau in 1845. Father of Samuel Rousseau and Lovell H. Rousseau, Jr. Studied law in Lexington, Kentucky. Attorney in Bloomfield, Indiana in 1842. Attorney in Louisville in 1849. Partner with Lovell H. Rousseau in a law firm in Louisville after 1849.

ab.bibl: The National Cyclopaedia of American Biography, Vol. XII (New York: James T. White & Company, 1904), 185.
